item.title: Kara add a quote by Fay Weldon
item.description: "guilt to motherhood is like grapes to wine" -- Fay Weldon

item.title: Kara add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kara add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Kara add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Kara add a quote by Richard Leigh
item.description: "You’ve got to sing like you don’t need the money, Love like you’ll never get hurt. You’ve got to dance like nobody’s watchin’." -- Richard Leigh

item.title: Kara add a quote by James Frey
item.description: "Leonard asks me if there's anything I need to know before he dies, I think about it for a minute, turn to him, say what's the meaning of life, Leonard? He laughs, says that's an easy one, my son, it's whatever you want it to be." -- James Frey

item.title: Kara add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "Shitbucket, hellfire, damnation, and son of a mother bitch," said Rosaleen, laying into each word like it was sweet potatoes on her tongue." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Kara add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "How do people, like, not curse? How is it possible? There are these gaps in speech where you just have to put a "fuck." I'll tell you who the most admirable people in the world are: newscasters. If that was me, I'd be like, "And the motherfuckers flew the fucking plane right into the Twin Towers." How could you not, if you're a human being? Maybe they're not so admirable. Maybe they're robot zombies." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kara add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kara add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kara add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kara add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "People see what they wish to see. And in most cases, what they are told that they see." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kara add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Life takes us to unexpected places sometimes. The future is never set in stone, remember that." -- Erin Morgenstern

item.title: Kara add a quote by Jeannette Walls
item.description: "New Yorkers, I figured, just pretended to be unfriendly." -- Jeannette Walls

item.title: Kara add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Never be so focused on what you're looking for that you overlook the thing you actually find." -- Ann Patchett
